dialogues.text: Light on. Relieved, Kyle turns his attention back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you want it to go off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty tomorrow evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what? Nineteen thirty minutes...what time is it now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle checks his wristwatch, sets the timer to eighteen ho eighteen minutes. It begins counting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Danny come around the corner, get in Kyle's car parked near the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stack of papers, the early edition of the Times. As Dan grabs one, he notices a stack of tabloids....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRONT PAGE: The Manzetti crime scene with screaming headl "MANZETTI SLAYER JEWISH NAZI." Next to this another tab:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny grabs a Times, flips it over... We see only his fac registering this, unsurprised. He opens the paper....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sweet-faced bar mitzvah boy we saw at his father's house... And a BLURRY PHOTO of Danny walking away from Gu Danielsen and the photographer outside Mrs. Moebius's hou Danny's face is not clearly seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm. He tucks the paper under his arm beside the machzor and crosses Eighth Avenue toward a cheap hotel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying the papers, Danny goes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny at the window, staring out. The TV plays behind him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On TV -- A REPORTER INTERVIEWING MRS. MOEBIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're saying that when he first appeared at your house, you had no idea he was Jewish....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None whatsoever. But I have to admit, I'm not terribly surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think anti-semitism today is largely a Jewish phenomenon. Wouldn't you agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny can't help smiling at her audacity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Third Reich, weren't a number of high-ranking Nazis of Jewish origin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and they were said to be the most virulent proponents of the Final Solution. Really, who but a Jew would want to kill Ilio Manzetti simply because he was Jewish? Who thinks about such things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers are going to report tomorrow that your colleague, Curtis Zampf, has been a federal informant for the past two years. Do you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enigmatic smile) Curtis is always more complicated than he seems. Even now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) And so, on this, the most solemn day of the Jewish year, a former yeshiva student is being sought in connection with a monstrous hate crime that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set is CLICKED OFF with the remote. In the darkened screen, we see Danny take his bag off the bed and go out door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Danny approaches, a STOCKY YOUNG MAN on a folding chai outside the front door checks him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamar tov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stocky Young Man beckons him on. As he passes, Danny spots a gun and shoulder holster inside the man's zippere jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Yom Kippur services are going on in different roo And we hear different groups of VOICES. And one reading..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny puts on his kittel -- a white prayer coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About forty WORSHIPPERS, most in their 20s and 30s. Danny slips into the back, spots Carla up front with Miriam and Stuart. He's shocked, appalled....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLA -- trying to follow along the prayer book, suddenly Danny is leaning over her shoulder from the row behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate whisper) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People sitting nearby HUSH him; he ignores them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam called, looking for you. She said you might come, so I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't own this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Danny, you can't just barge in and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up. Who do you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carla, low, urgent) There's a bomb here. It's going to go off at seven-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHUSHING becomes louder.... She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Yom Kippur.... People are davening.... Can you take it outside.... You have some nerve....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks around at the scolding, angry, pious faces... He hates them. He sits back and closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jewish father (played by Danny's father) is ripping o the Sergeant's jugular as the soldiers shoot him. One of soldiers (who is now Danny) says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them. Kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers begin firing.... But now, three Israeli commandos appear, Danny, Avi and the security guard we sa outside. They fire Uzis at the Nazis, who fire back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny the Nazi soldier and Danny the Israeli commando fir at each other at point-blank range. The SOUND fades and w hear SCRAPING CHAIRS, MURMURS, VOICES....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny wakes with a start. People are about to resume afte break, but there's some confusion. People are talking to Stuart, who keeps glancing toward Danny....Danny finds hi machzor and gets up...as he approaches the bema, Stuart comes to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, listen, people expect me to daven; they don't want someone they don't know -- leading their prayers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart backs down. Danny steps onto the bema, opens the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?... Who is this?...I thought Stuart was davening....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the room) Page 766.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at a clock at the back of the room: 6:14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yis-gadal, v'yis-kadash sh'mey raba...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People join in, but one man, in back, is outraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, you know who that is?... You see the paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently teasing) You're reading the paper on Yom Kippur, Barry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the paper. That's not him, that guy was darker.... This is somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy wouldn't go to shul, Barry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to bet? I'll bet you anything... (he's SHUSHED, "Could you, please...") Let's go, we're leaving....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for God's sake, you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks to the door but doesn't leave, turns back as if compelled to watch this outrage...as....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da-amiran b'alma, v'imru amen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins the silent amidah, taking three steps backward, then three forward, bowing as he prays so that he sees th watch on the lectern.... It says: 6:16....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle on hands and knees, gasping for breath, his face blo DRAKE sits in a chair, injecting methamphetamine into the vein of his forearm. Billings comes through the door with newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squats beside Kyle, shows him the Times story about Da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now do you know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle thinks, glances at a watch: 6:47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I bet I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows have darkened. The congregation is on its fee chanting the AVINU MALKENU, the climactic prayer of the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, leading the prayers, looks up at Carla, Stuart, Miriam...near the front, chanting with him. He looks at t clock: 7:21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly it seems impossible to go through with this. He stops praying, but no one notices....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kyle, Drake and Billings approach, the place seems to glow with an inner radiance. Drake and Billings hold weap at their sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stocky security guard sees them coming and gets up, reaching for his gun. Billings and Drake stop. Kyle wishe he weren't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything suspends for a moment as, within the building, three distinct GROUPS OF VOICES can be heard, each chanti the AVINU MALKENU at a slightly different point in the pr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake raises his gun and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are chanting AVINU MALKENU so fervently that the GUNFIRE outside seems only a faint POPPING. No one particularly notices. Danny, freaking, doesn't hear the gunshots. He tries to address the people in the front row

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the praying is too loud, too strong. No one stops or listens. He steps down off the bema....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop praying. You've got to get out of here.... All of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few people in front are puzzled by his strange behavior but the rest keep chanting. Stuart comes up to Danny....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to daven. Now daven....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny glances over people's heads at the clock: 7:25. He doesn't notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANGS open. DRAKE stands there, .357, bleeding profusely from the head, the swastika on his lips. At first, only a few people notice, they stop praying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panic, confusion) Who's that?... What is he...oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avi is the first one out of his chair, walks right at Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, forceful) Put down the weapon. Put it down....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake shoots him. Avi goes down, writhing in pain. Scream panic. People come at Drake, but he grabs an 11-year-old girl, puts the gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake! Up here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns, including Drake -- who's blinded by the blood in his eyes, but recognizes the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, he knows him. The Nazi bastard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake moves unsteadily toward the front, pulling the girl with him. A WOMAN (a doctor) goes to tend Avi, who is sti conscious. People begin to slip out the back, taking children. Others stay, looking to jump Drake, but he keep the .357 on the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carla, Miriam, Stuart) Get everybody out of here. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps back onto the bema, separating himself from the others and drawing Drake's attention. The clock reads 7:2 Outside we begin to hear SIRENS....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake refocuses, pulls the girl on.... From the hall, we hear OTHER GROUPS in the building, chanting....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avinu malkenu, choney-nu v'aneyenu... Avinu malkenu, choney-nu v'aneyenu, ki eyn banu ma-asim... (Our father, out king, graciously answer us though we are undeserving...) -- nu va-aneynu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the front, Drake wobbles. People start forward. He coc the gun against the little girl's head. She's weeping sil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake, I'm right here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake looks. Danny reaches out a hand. Drake points the . at him and FIRES, missing. A HAND grabs the little girl, pulls her to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is nearly empty now, save Miriam, Carla, Stuart, few others. The AVINU MALKENU can still be heard from the hall....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the door) Let them kill each other. They're animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry, for God's sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake wobbles from loss of blood. Nearly drops the .357.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny glances at the clock: 7:30. What is it, another dud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake FIRES again, hits Danny in the shoulder....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs forward. The shoulder hurts; he calls to the oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET HER OUT OF HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam, others, grab Carla, pull Carla toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake comes toward Danny, trying to lift the .357 for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cha'nainu v'anainu, ki ain baw-nu ma'ah-seem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny grabs Drake's gun hand, forces it up in the air. Th gun goes off. Plaster rains down on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake dies. Danny catches him under the arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the watch: 7:32. He relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fervent) ...Asey imanu tz'dakah va'chesed... Asey imanu tz'dakah va'chesd, v'ho- shi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instant before the prayer ends...it's cut off by a sudden silence. Then a FLASH of light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREEN GOES WHITE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we saw Danny leave the school as a 12-year-old. Now LOOKING DOWN, we see Danny as an adult, coming up them tw at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING DANNY as he races up. His old teacher, RAV ZINGESSER, appears on a landing above....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, good to see you...I wanted to take up that discussion we were having... (as Danny hurries past) ...about Abraham and Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't right now....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he nears the NEXT LANDING, there is Zingesser wait for him again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember what you said, that Isaac actually died on Mt. Moriah? I've been thinking maybe you're right... Died yet was reborn in olam ha-bah....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny goes past once more....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now, LOOKING DOWN at Zingesser as he appears above Da yet again. As Danny nears the landing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, stop... (as Danny goes by, calling after him) ...Where are you going?... Don't you know, there's nobody up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Danny passes the camera we PAN to watch him still raci upward. beyond us into the darkness....
